content: weaving spider s socks mojca čepič aka maramacko photo 1 photo 2 the intarsia cables placed in front continue to the instep while the cables at the back of the leg the intarsia cables disappear into the gusset introduction these socks were inspired by a pair of socks knit during swc and a cabled sweater knit for my partner a few years ago the socks were the high-octane socks in the lap 2 of supersock world 1 championship in 2023 called kurt they are delicately and beautifully cabled when i saw them i wanted to make the cables more pronounced in complementary colours red on green and the fraternal green on red they turned out beautifully however already during knitting i started to think about socks that would include cables in colour and here they are i intentionally used cables from my partner s sweater which i call open cables they are a little complicated to knit because the main feature of these cables is the order of the stitches a cable cross extends over three stitches one knit one purl and another knit the left and the right knit stitches cross to the left or to the right according to the pattern but the purl in the middle remains backwards behind the crossing knits and does not change the position in this way an elevated weaved net of a spider who learned to weave appears the cable pattern in solid is attractive by itself since it offers many combinations and could be used in items that need two functional sides like scarves adding the colour component where knits are in different colours than purls in the cables makes these cables special the knitting itself is not demanding although one stitch intarsia slows down the knitting with cables one must be careful if stitches are not ordered correctly blips of cc colour in mc columns or vice versa occur and spoil the effect of the strange spider who makes his net like humans weave the cloth 1 https //www ravelry com/patterns/library/kurt-6 1 finally the stitches on the needles are not distributed as front and back leg or instep and sole stitches they are shifted and combined rearrangement to the instep and sole stitches takes p lace after the heel turn so just stay calm and follow
